results.title: Tank wars
results.brief_description: Command your tank around the battlefield to destroy all other tanks. Four levels, working on a scoring system. Objective is to kill all enemies in the least amount of time.

results.title: Tank girl
results.creator_credit: Rachel Talalay, John Watson, Pen Densham, Richard Lewis, Trilogy Entertainment Group and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: The year is 2033 and water is a precious commodity. In the desolate wind swept plains, animals are banned, bathing is unheard of, and the Water & Power Company, headed by the villainous Kesslee (Malcolm McDowell), have ultimate control over the precious H20. One rebel girl stands in their way, Rebecca (Lori Petty), a chick with attitude and an outrageous hairstyle. She is captured by Water & Power when they kill her boyfriend, kidnap her young friend, and try to blackmail her into joining their team. As a prisoner Rebecca discovers a new passion- tanks, and makes a friend with mechanic and pilot, Jet Girl (Naomi Watts), who helps her escape. Once free the girls join forces with The Rippers, an army of half men and half kangaroos, genetically modified to be the ultimate fighting machines. Together they take Water & Power head on, lead by Jet Girl in the sky, and tank girl on the ground with her beloved tank in a flurry of live action and comic strip visuals. Cast also includes Ice-T, Don Harvey and Jeff Kober.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rachel Talalay, John Watson, Pen Densham, Richard Lewis, Trilogy Entertainment Group and United Artists Corporation

results.title: Tanjong Karang: Malaya
results.brief_description: In 1951 Malaya could only produce sufficient rice to supply half the needs of her population. At the Tanjong Karang Irrigation Scheme, swamp land is being reclaimed and put under rice cultivation.
results.description: In 1951 Malaya could only produce sufficient rice to supply half the needs of her population. At the Tanjong Karang Irrigation Scheme, swamp land is being reclaimed and put under rice cultivation.

results.title: Tangramation
results.creator_credit: Alister MacGregor, John Bird and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Tangra is an ancient game from China; a square is divided into seven pieces from which an amazing range of figures and shapes can be constructed, from a house to a horse, from a bird to a boat. This short film explores some of the possibilities of this fascinating activity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alister MacGregor, John Bird and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: Tangram
results.brief_description: Uses animation of the seven geometric pieces of the tangram, an ancient Chinese puzzle, to show the kinds of patterns which can be created.

results.title: Tango of our childhood
results.creator_credit: Albert Mkrtchyan and Armenfilm U S S R
results.brief_description:
This melancholic comedy is a story of post-war displacement and one man’s sense of conflicting loyalties. Ruben, an Armenian, returns to his family after the war, only to leave them to go live with a nurse who saved his life. His proud wife, struck by the insult, enlists the help of her children in order to entice her husband back to the family home. Lurching between the two homes leaves Ruben in a state of abject confusion about his familial duties and personal needs.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Mkrtchyan ; photography, Rudolf Vatinian ; music, T. Mansurian ; editing, S. Gabrielyan.
Cast: Galya Novents, Mger Mkrchian, Elina Agamyan, Narine Bagadasaryan, Samvel Sarkisyan, Azat Gasparyan.

results.title: Tango Bar
results.creator_credit: Marcos Zurinaga, Roberto Gandara, Juan Carlos Codazzi, Zaga Films and Beco Films
results.brief_description: Raul Julia stars in this story of a trio of performers who play, sing and dance at the “Tango Bar” in Buenos Aires. The trio are split apart by a revolution in Argentina and reunited after 10 years of exile. Whilst the plot of “Tango Bar” revolves around the story of Pedro (Raul Julia), Elena (Valeria Lynch) and Antonio (Ruben Jaurez), it is primarily a tribute to Tango in Argentina. As they perform their show at the Tango Bar - singing, dancing tango and talking about its history and politics, the film flashes to dance sequences of tango performed at various times in the history of the dance form. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Tango among friends
results.brief_description: Tangos Among Friends is a personal pilgrimage by pianist and conductor Daniel Barenboim to his hometown of Buenos Aires. The film intersperses Barenboim’s exposition of the history of the development of Tango music in Argentina with excerpts from concerts where Barenboim performs pieces by renowned Tango composers (such as Carlos Gardel and Piazzolla), with double bass player Hector Console and accordionist Rodolfo Mederos. Barenboim also performs a duet with Placido Domingo and there is also an example of Tango dancing. “Tangos Among Friends” is a fascinating journey into the wonders of Tango music and dance as well as the cultural life of Argentina. The video comes with a booklet that gives details of the songs included in the film and of the three musicians performing the music. In English and Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Tango
results.creator_credit: Carlos Saura, Juan Carlos Codazzi, Carlos L. Mentasti, Luis Scalella, Terraplen Producciones, Saura Films, Hollywood Partners, Beco Films, Astrolabio Producciones, Argentina Sono Films, Alma Ata International Pictures, Adela Pictures and Pandora Cinema
results.brief_description: This Argentinian/Spanish co-production is a dance film within a dance film which blurs the lines between rehearsal, real life and performance. Set in Buenos Aires, the film’s slender plot centres on the creative processes of a womanising, middle-aged director who, whilst recovering from a marriage breakup, decides to make a musical centred on the tango. Bearing a close resemblance to the protagonist in Fellini’s “8 1/2” the director dwells on his childhood memories, middle-aged regret and wounded heart as he prepares his film. With only the thinnest of narrative threads linking scenes and moments together, the film relies far more heavily on colour, movement and music than on dialogue or characterisation. The bulk of the film is devoted to expertly-choreographed performances which explore both the fictional director’s personal demons and moments in Argentinian history. Stunningly photographed by Vittorio Storaro. Cast: Miguel Angel Sola, Cecilia Narova, Mia Maestro, Juan Carlos Copes, Carlos Rivarola. In Spanish with English subtitles.
